Title.evidence: Perioperative Outcomes of Neoadjuvant Nivolumab or Nivolumab Plus Ipilimumab in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Forty-four patients with stage I-IIIA NSCLC were randomised

Participants.evidence: patients with stage I-IIIA non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)

Intervention.evidence: randomised to receive either N (3 mg/kg intravenously on days 1, 15, and 29; n = 23) or NI (N plus ipilimumab 1 mg/kg intravenously on day 1; n = 21)

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluated the perioperative outcomes of neoadjuvant nivolumab (N) or nivolumab plus ipilimumab (NI)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the rate of R0 resection, assessed at surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Forty-four patients with stage I-IIIA NSCLC were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: All 37 resected patients achieved R0 resection.

Harms.evidence: Complications included pulmonary (24%), cardiac (11%), enteric (5%), neurologic (3%), and wound (3%).
